Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Great Wall of China is the only man-made object visible from the moon.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the visibility of the Great Wall of China from the moon.
Understate: The claim understates the visibility of other man-made objects from space.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove its accuracy.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Great Wall of China is the only man-made object visible from the moon.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim has an alternative explanation that the belief originated from Richard Halliburton's book.
